attributes.action: allow the family of Lynda Mann to create an Downing Street e-petition on this site, requesting that her killer Colin Pitchfork never be released from prison.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The family of murdered schoolgirl Lynda Mann has been banned from putting a petition on the this website demanding killer Colin Pitchfork stays in jail for the rest of his life. Downing Street officials told the family the subject matter is "not appropriate" for an online petition. Simon Eaton, 32, of Wigston, is the cousin of Lynda, who was raped and murdered by Pitchfork in 1983. He wanted to put a petition on this website demanding Pitchfork – who also raped and murdered 15-year-old Dawn Ashworth – is not allowed to leave jail early. The double child killer was jailed for life in 1988. Last week, he appeared at the Court of Appeal in a bid to reduce his minimum 30-year tariff. "We feel very strongly that this man should spend the rest of his life behind bars," said Simon. "I wanted to do my bit to help and thought a petition on the Number 10 website might be good. There are petitions for all sorts of things on the website – and yet we're not allowed to put a petition on there about this." 
If you believe that the family of Lynda Mann have earned the right to place a petition on this site then please sign below.

rejection.details:
The Number 10 website cannot accept petitions discussing individual legal cases, as explained in our terms and conditions: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/terms
The family were invited to re-word and resubmit their petition to fit in with these terms and conditions and that petition is here: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/childrendead/
Other comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk
